snippet: The bodies of seven ethnic Hazara civilians were found Saturday after the Taliban had pushed back the militants and a group of allied dissidents, officials said.
abstract: Breakaway Taliban militants loyal to Islamic State behead seven kidnapped ethnic Hazaras, including two children; officials say increasing factionalization, rather than weakening Taliban, makes group more threatening to Afghan civilians, government and security forces.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The bodies of seven ethnic Hazara civilians were found Saturday after the Taliban had pushed back the militants and a group of allied dissidents, officials said.

headline.main: Afghan Fighters Loyal to ISIS Beheaded 7 Hostages, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Afghan Fighters Loyal to Islamic State Beheaded 7 Hostages, Officials Say

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
